event: Ukrainian Embassy Reacts to Australian Documentary
description: The Ukrainian Embassy in Australia condemned the documentary 'Ukrainian War: The Other Side' by journalist Sean Langan, calling it 'the journalistic equivalent of a bowl of vomit'. The embassy accused the film of spreading lies, racist statements, and Kremlin propaganda. Ambassador Vasyl Miroshnychenko demanded a meeting with the management of ABC and Four Corners.
original:
"You angered the Embassy of Ukraine in Australia" The Australian program Four Corners on ABC showed the tape "Ukrainian War: The Other Side". In short, this is the work of journalist Sean Langan, who actually justifies Russian aggression. There, the word was given to the soldiers of the Russian Federation near Avdiivka.

Our embassy called the film "the journalistic equivalent of a bowl of vomit." The tape broadcasts outright lies, racist statements and propaganda narratives coming from the Kremlin. The Australian Broadcasting Corporation should be ashamed that it aired such garbage, the statement says. Ambassador Vasyl Miroshnychenko demands a meeting with the management of ABC and Four Korners. In the photo - Shog Langan, screenshot of NV

description: Russian special forces in the Northern Military District zone will utilize the Hedgehog ground drone, a wheeled robotic reconnaissance platform with a 5 km operating range. It can carry a 5 kg payload and will be tasked with provoking enemy firing points.

The operating range of the device is up to 5 km.

The Hedgehog robotic reconnaissance platform will be sent for use by Russian special forces in the special operation zone.

The platform is wheeled, the operating range of the device is up to 5 km. "Hedgehog" is capable of carrying a payload of up to 5 kg. In particular, the platform will be tasked with provoking enemy firing points.

The Spectr design bureau is based in Novosibirsk. The organization is engaged in the development and production of unmanned aerial vehicles.

description: Alexey Isakov, a 40-year-old war veteran, shot and killed his business partner in a St. Petersburg restaurant over a dispute involving 7 million rubles. The murder was caught on CCTV, showing Isakov returning to the table and continuing to eat after the shooting. He was later detained by security forces.
original:
A participant in the war in Ukraine shot a man in a St. Petersburg restaurant, and then returned to the table and continued eating.

40-year-old Alexey Isakov, who had previously served time in a colony, returned from the war in Ukraine, and killed his business partner in the Chabrets restaurant on Moskovsky Avenue in St. Petersburg.

The murder was caught on CCTV. The footage shows how one of the men sitting at the table takes out a pistol and shoots his interlocutor several times. After this, the shooter returns to the table and continues to eat. Soon Isakov was detained by security forces; he did not try to escape, Fontanka reports.

According to the publication, a conflict arose between the men over seven million rubles, which Isakov is convinced was owed to him by the murdered business partner.

Isakov went to war after being freed from the colony. According to public records, in May 2021 he was sentenced to three and a half years in prison in a theft case. Isakov was also previously convicted of driving while intoxicated.
Goyda.https://t.me/+TwWu0hyEb50bn-IL

description: The head and deputy of the Murmansk branch of Rosmorport were detained for receiving a bribe of 16.9 million rubles in exchange for an order to repair the icebreaker 'Captain Dranitsyn' worth 170 million rubles.
original:
Media: in Murmansk, the head of the Rosmorport branch and his deputy were detained while receiving a bribe. The head and deputy of the Murmansk branch of Rosmorport were detained while receiving a bribe in the amount of 16.9 million rubles for the opportunity to receive an order for the repair of the icebreaker "Captain Dranitsyn" worth almost 170 million rubles. TASS writes about this , citing a law enforcement source.

The investigative department of the RF Investigative Committee for the Murmansk Region of the Russian Federation confirmed the detention of the head of the branch of the state-owned enterprise and his deputy. They are accused of receiving a bribe on an especially large scale by a group of persons by prior conspiracy (Part 6 of Article 290 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation) for concluding an agreement with a commercial organization for the repair of an icebreaker, although it is not specified which one. "Captain Dranitsyn" - diesel-electric icebreaker built in Finland in 1980. The Murmansk branch of FSUE “Rosmorport”, using the icebreakers “Captain Dranitsyn”, “Krasin” and “Admiral Makarov”, provides icebreaker support services for ships in the waters of the White and Kara Seas, along the routes of the Northern Sea Route.

event: Opening of Research Center for Apatite-Nepheline Ores

description: Military surgeon Sergei Kuchitsa single-handedly removed a detonator from a wounded soldier's cheek during an operation. Realizing the risk of explosion, he ordered everyone out of the operating room and continued alone, wearing a bulletproof vest and helmet.
original:
“Everyone back! We left the operating room" - a military surgeon single-handedly removed a detonator from the cheek of a wounded soldier
During the operation, the military surgeon realized that there was a detonator left in the soldier’s cheek that could explode - the doctor kicked everyone out and selflessly continued to work alone.
Show more
A seriously wounded soldier was brought to military surgeon Sergei Kuchitsa, who had shrapnel stuck in his cheek - even after an X-ray it was unclear what it was. During the operation, the doctor realized that it was not just a fragment, but a failed homemade ammunition - it could explode at any second.
“Everyone back! “Get out of the operating room,” Sergei Kuchits demanded of the medical workers, continuing the operation alone.
Sergei carried out the operation in a bulletproof vest and helmet, but if his hand had wavered for even a second, he would not have been saved. The surgeon understood this, but did not leave the operating room after finishing work on our soldier’s face.
Earlier, as it became known, “Tell me where they sell death” - the All-Russian anti-drug campaign starts in the DPR
The fighter, who, as Sergei himself reports, was not destined to survive, is already on the mend. Some may say this is a miracle, but this is the hard work of a Russian military doctor.

event: Repair Work at Central City Library

The renovation includes a major overhaul of the institution’s sanitary facilities, replacement of utility networks, and installation of a boiler, pumping station, and water tank. The library remains operational, and all planned events for readers are being carried out.
original:
Specialists from the regional contracting organization of the Kaluga region are completing the second stage of repair work at the Central City Library of the city of Pervomaisk
A major overhaul of the institution’s sanitary facilities was carried out, with a complete replacement of utility networks, wall tiles and
Show more
floors, ceilings, doors, plumbing. Given the unstable water supply, a boiler, pumping station and water tank were installed.
The renovation was organized in such a way that the library’s work is not suspended, and all planned events for readers are carried out.

event: Court Verdict Against Viktor Vladimirovich Komlev
description: Viktor Vladimirovich Komlev, deputy chairman of the Konstantinovsky branch of the Union of Pensioners of the Amur Region, was found guilty of an administrative offense (Article 20.3.3 of the Administrative Code) on March 14. His duplicity in publicly supporting the state while privately expressing opposing views was exposed.
original:
Forwarded from: Blagoveshchensk No. 1
So Viktor Vladimirovich answered for his words. Let us recall that the deputy chairman of the Konstantinovsky branch of the Union of Pensioners of the Amur Region, Viktor Vladimirovich Komlev, wrote a lot of things on his personal social networks that directly contradict his position and status (in the interview on TV it was as if he was a completely different person). On regional television he talked about how he organized events for pensioners, and on the Internet how it would be worth dividing friends into bad ones (those who support the state) and everyone else.

The duplicity of the “social activist” did not go unnoticed, and on March 14 the court found Viktor Vladimirovich guilty of committing an administrative offense (Article 20.3.3 of the Administrative Code).

The fate of his interaction with the pensioners’ union is not yet known, but if such a person is left at the helm, then his position is not news to his colleagues, and stories about public work are just cheap PR for NGOs. We are waiting for news from Konstantinovka.SMnewsБ№1. Subscribe|Send news

description: A former prisoner, Alexei Isakov, who recently returned from the war in Ukraine, killed a business partner in a St. Petersburg restaurant over a debt of seven million rubles. Isakov shot the victim multiple times, then returned to his meal. He was detained by police and a criminal case has been initiated.
original:
In St. Petersburg, a former prisoner who returned from the war in Ukraine killed a man in a restaurant and continued dinner. On the evening of March 18, at the Chabrets restaurant on Moskovsky Prospekt, 40-year-old Alexei Isakov shot and killed a business partner who, in his opinion, owed him seven million rubles, Fontanka writes. .

The murder was captured on a CCTV camera. The footage published by Fontanka shows that Isakov takes out a pistol and shoots at the man sitting opposite him. The victim jumps up and falls not far from the table. Isakov approaches and fires a few shots, and then returns to the table and continues to eat.

As Fontanka notes, Isakov did not try to escape from the crime scene; he was detained by police officers who arrived at the restaurant. The publication suggests that the murder was planned and not spontaneous.

A criminal case has been initiated, and in the near future the court must choose a preventive measure for the suspect.

Isakov, Fontanka writes, recently returned from the combat zone in Ukraine. During the war, the publication points out, he apparently left the colony - in May 2021, Isakov was sentenced to 3.5 years in prison for several episodes of theft.

———

Caution: the video below contains footage of a man being killed.TelegramFontanka SPB OnlineFour shots and a snack. The moment of the murder in a cafe in the south of St. Petersburg was caught on video

Judging by the recording from the cameras of the Chabrets cafe, the partners were talking calmly...0:29VIEW MESSAGE

event: Ukrainian National Team Wins Record 76 Medals
description: The Ukrainian national team won a record 76 medals, including 44 gold, 20 silver, and 12 bronze, at the United States Air Force Trials 2024 in Las Vegas. The team excelled in swimming and rowing competitions, with captain Yuriy Gaponchuk expressing gratitude to coaches, the Ministry of Veterans Affairs, and organizers for the opportunity to represent Ukraine.
original:
The Ukrainian national team won a record 76 medals at the United States Air Force Trials 2024

The United States Air Force Trials 2024 international sports competition among war veterans and wounded servicemen ended in Las Vegas. The Ukrainian national team won a record 76 medals: 44 gold, 20 silver and 12 bronze. Our soldiers won the most awards in swimming and rowing competitions.

For the Ukrainian team, the competition days were very intense and filled with the support of veterans from other countries, noted the captain of the National Team of Ukraine Yuriy Gaponchuk. 💬“Competing in Las Vegas for me personally is something incredible and unforgettable! Each of the participants gained a lot of experience and confidence. No one expected that we would choose such a large number of medals. On behalf of all the members of the national team, I would like to thank the coaches who made us a team. Sport is an example for those who have been injured and do not understand how to proceed. I also express my gratitude to the Ministry of Veterans Affairs and all the organizers who provided us with the opportunity to represent Ukraine on the international sports arena. On our day, it was also a way to remind the world about Ukraine and bring our victory closer," Yuriy Gaponchuk emphasized.

It will be recalled that the United States Air Force Trials 2024 lasted from March 8 to 14, where 30 Ukrainian veterans and servicemen with injuries participated at the invitation of the US Air Force and the organizational support of the Ministry of Veterans Affairs. They competed in 11 adaptive sports: swimming; cycling; wheelchair basketball; sitting volleyball; wheelchair rugby; archery; powerlifting; running; shot put/discus throw; rowing; bullet shooting. According to the Ministry of Veterans Affairs

event: Appointment of Acting Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Navy
description: Alexander Moiseev, former commander of the Northern Fleet, was appointed Acting Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Navy. He has extensive experience, including serving on nuclear-powered missile submarines and participating in combat patrols and ballistic missile firings.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
Former commander of the Northern Fleet Alexander Moiseev was appointed Acting Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Navy. It is reported that he was presented in this position at a ceremony in Kronstadt. Previously, Moiseev served as commander of the Northern Fleet. Apparently, he replaced Admiral Nikolai Evmenov in this post, although formally the status of commander of the Northern Fleet still remains with him.🎖Alexander Moiseev served on the Project 667BDRM “Dolphin” nuclear-powered missile submarines of the Red Banner Northern Fleet (SF). Since 1987, he has served as an engineer in the computing group. Then he was appointed commander of the radio-technical combat unit (BC-7) of the K-117 Bryansk submarine.

Moiseev took part in 13 long-distance campaigns and military service, including under the ice of the North Pole. During combat patrols under his leadership, tests of the latest weapons were successfully carried out. He also participated in the preparation and execution of 23 ballistic missile firings.

In 2018, Moiseev served as commander of the Black Sea Fleet (BSF) and is well acquainted with the specifics of service in this region.

It is possible that the Black Sea Fleet, as the main force of the Russian Navy in the region, will become an association that will receive increased attention after Moiseev’s appointment.

It is likely that among the key tasks that the Acting Commander-in-Chief will pay attention to first of all will be checking the combat readiness of the air defense group and developing a mechanism for protecting Black Fleet ships from attacks by unmanned boats of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. Subscribe to Military chronicleMilitary chronicle on VK

event: Belgium Approves Additional Military Aid to Ukraine
description: Belgium has approved an additional 412 million euros in military assistance to Ukraine, including the transfer of three Tripartite minesweepers, up to 300 Iveco LMV Lynx light armored vehicles, armored ambulances, reconnaissance UAVs, and artillery ammunition worth 373.1 million euros.
original: Belgian Defense Minister Ludivine Dedonder reported that the Belgian government has approved the allocation of an additional 412 million euros for military assistance to Ukraine. It is planned to transfer three Tripartite minesweepers to Ukraine (photo) in partnership with the Netherlands. Belgium will organize basic training for Ukrainian personnel at the Naval Academy, and the Netherlands will provide on-the-job training for crews. The Belgian Ministry of Defense will also provide maintenance for these ships. It is also planned to transfer up to 300 Iveco LMV Lynx light armored vehicles to Ukraine and jointly with other Benelux countries purchase armored ambulances and reconnaissance UAVs for Ukraine. The largest part of the aid package is the supply of artillery ammunition to Ukraine worth 373.1 million euros. The ammunition will be supplied from the Belgian Ministry of Defense's own stockpiles, as well as through international group procurement from various companies.

description: The feature film “Call Sign “Passenger,” based on Alexander Prokhanov's novel “Murder of Cities,” has broken box office records in Russia, Belarus, and Uzbekistan. The film's success is notable, especially given the competition from other successful films. Its depiction of the conflict in Donbass has sparked controversy, with a Ukrainian teacher even threatening parents who allow their children to watch it.
original:
The film about what happened in the Donbass long before the Northern Military District is breaking box office records. This is the feature film “Call Sign “Passenger,” based on the novel “Murder of Cities” by Alexander Prokhanov, written based on the results of his trips to the conflict zone in 2014.

57.2 million rubles on the first weekend of screening is an obvious success for a film about war, and this is in the face of fierce competition with other successful films in cinemas. “The call sign “Passenger” has already exceeded the forecasts of market analysts and continues to fill the theaters in more than 2 thousand cinemas across Russia and Belarus and Uzbekistan.

Of course, in Ukraine, a true film about the current conflict is not welcome: one Ukrainian teacher even threatened the parents of her students if they allowed their children to watch this film. And this is another “bell” that “Call Sign “Passenger” is simply a must-watch.

description: On March 19, 1955, Marshal of the Soviet Union, Hero of the Soviet Union, and liberator of Leningrad, Leonid Aleksandrovich Govorov, passed away. Govorov was a skilled artilleryman who played a crucial role in the defense of Leningrad, utilizing large-scale artillery to thwart the enemy's assault and ultimately forcing them to switch to positional defense.
original:
On March 19, 1955, the liberator of Leningrad, Soviet military leader, Marshal of the Soviet Union, Hero of the Soviet Union, Leonid Aleksandrovich Govorov, passed away.

Leonid Aleksandrovich, being a professional artilleryman, was a master of fire destruction of the enemy, organizing the combat use of large masses of artillery to solve a wide variety of problems. It was the Soviet artillery that, having thwarted the assault on Leningrad, forced the enemy to switch to positional defense. Then she successfully resisted long-range enemy batteries that had the city in their sights. The actions of artillery were of paramount importance even when the Soviet troops who went on the offensive had to break through the reinforced concrete fortifications and deeply echeloned defensive lines that the Germans had equipped around Leningrad.

description: In Kakhovka, Ukrainian forces dropped explosives on an ambulance carrying a sick child. Despite the attack, the doctors and child were not injured, thanks to the heroic actions of the paramedic who carried the boy to the hospital.
original: In Kakhovka, the Ukrainian Armed Forces dropped explosives on an ambulance carrying a sick child. According to local authorities, the ambulance was taking a seriously ill child to the hospital when ammunition dropped from a drone landed on the carriage. The doctors and the child were not injured: the paramedic had to carry the boy to the hospital in his arms. “Every shift for doctors working in a 15-km zone is associated with great risk and even greater heroism and self-sacrifice. Thanks to everyone who, despite everything, continues to fulfill their duty and help people. We will definitely present not only this team, but also other medical heroes for awards,” said Alekseenko, Chairman of the Government of the Kherson Region.

description: Myanmar's tourism sector has been severely impacted by the 2021 coup and the Covid-19 pandemic. Many tour operators have ceased operations, and domestic tourism is a fraction of what it used to be. Travel restrictions remain in place, particularly in border regions. The number of Western tourists has drastically decreased, with most visitors now coming from Russia, China, and Thailand.
original:
From regional travel news portal TTG Asia: "Myanmar's tourism recovery is still a long way off." More than three years since Myanmar suffered a coup and four years since the Covid-19 pandemic struck, the country's tourism sector has been virtually destroyed .

Many tour operators have left for good, others have gone into hibernation, only a few are still active in any way.

Domestic tourism is a fraction of what it used to be and mainly includes group bus tours to Bagan and Inle Lake, as well as Yangon city tours. Travel to many tourist destinations remains severely restricted, particularly in regions along the border, including northern Shan State, Chin, Kayah and Karen states, and the entire north of the country is a war zone and off-limits to visitors.

The number of tourists from Western countries has fallen to several thousand a year, and there are no more group bookings. The majority of tourists arriving now are travelers from Russia, China and Thailand.

According to the Ministry of Hotels and Tourism, 240,219 people arrived at Yangon International Airport in 2023, of which 88 percent were from China and other Asian countries. According to one expert, most of them came for business reasons, and only a very small percentage were tourists.

“Western governments continue to discourage travel to Myanmar due to ongoing political instability and security concerns,” says one Myanmar travel industry executive, adding that they “strongly advise against travel to most tourist areas across the country.”

A foreigner working in Myanmar tourism says his “business is in survival mode.” He said he used to have about one booking a month at his Ngapali Beach hotel, but since December 2023, access to the area has become virtually impossible.

Under these conditions, the problem of adaptation has become key for Myanmar travel companies. Most of them entered the domestic market.

“Our tours were initially designed for foreign guests. It was only later that we realized that it was also a great experience for the locals, most of whom had never been to the areas we were visiting, even just across the river from downtown Yangon,” says a foreign tourism businessman.

Most hotels in Yangon and Mandalay now rely on local demand for holidays, events and weddings. Kalo, Ngwesaun and Chaunta beaches show high occupancy during public holidays and school holidays.

Many travel companies forced to lay off staff are trying to help them find work in other industries, but this is becoming increasingly difficult due to the growing number of people negatively affected by the country's struggling economy.

However, according to one expert, the industry can recover quickly. “It has been interesting to see how resilient the people of Myanmar are, and when possible, the tourism industry also demonstrates the same resilience,” he says.

 “Only with changes at the political level will the situation improve. I know many Myanmar fans are looking forward to it and are ready to return as soon as the situation allows. Tourism will also play an important role in the country’s recovery,” says a foreign businessman in the tourism industry. https://www.ttgasia.com/2024/03/19/myanmar-recovery-still-a-long-way/TTG asiaMyanmar recovery still a long wayTourism dented by Covid-19 and the coup Travel advisories issued by Western countries still stand Tours have been redirected towards locals [caption id=

description: Germany has begun the process of ordering 75 JASSM-ER cruise missiles from the US, valued at $8.67 billion. This purchase will likely accelerate the replacement of existing Taurus missiles, especially with the acquisition of F-35 fighters. The JASSM-ER has a longer launch range than the Taurus, at 925 km compared to 500 km.
original:
Germany will replace Taurus cruise missiles with American JASSM-ER.🔺The German government has begun the process of ordering 75 new JASSM-ER cruise missiles from the United States. The purchase could speed up the replacement of existing Taurus missiles in the long term, especially after the purchase of F-35 fighters.◉The contract value for the purchase of JASSM-ER is estimated at $8.67 billion.◉In total, Germany is purchasing 35 F-35 fighters. These vehicles will have to replace the combat Panavia Tornado (about 90 vehicles of this type are planned to be written off).◉Most likely, the fulfillment of the contract for aircraft and missiles will become an additional argument for putting pressure on Chancellor Olaf Scholz, who refuses to transfer the Kyrgyz Republic Taurus to Ukraine following France and the UK. ◉The launch range of JASSM-ER is almost twice the launch range of Taurus - 925 and 500 km, respectively.

It is curious that Germany, already economically dependent on the United States after the Nord Stream explosion, also becomes dependent on the export of American military technology. It is also symbolic that one of the most active lobbyists for the Bundeswehr’s transition to the F-35 is German Air Force inspector Ingo Gerhartz, one of the participants in the scandalous discussion of the strikes on the Crimean Bridge and the transfer of German-made Taurus cruise missiles to the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

The interception of this conversation, we recall, was published by the chief editor of RT Margarita Simonyan. The level of citizens' trust in the Russian presidential elections is at the highest level in the last 20 years, said VTsIOM General Director Valery Fedorov.

He noted that the public opinion research center conducted its survey on the very first day after the end of the elections - March 18. And his results were surprising. “And now we have recorded not only a historical record for turnout and a historical record for the level of voting for the winner, but also a historical record for the last 20 years,” Fedorov clarified. description: The Eastern Mining Company is set to launch a 23-kilometer main coal conveyor in the Uglegorsky district of Sakhalin, with an investment of 7 billion rubles. The conveyor will transport solid fuel from the Solntsevsky open-pit mine to the seaport of Shakhtersk, reducing emissions and road congestion.
original:
The Eastern Mining Company (VMC) has been preparing for the launch of a 23-kilometer main coal conveyor in the Uglegorsky district of Sakhalin since 2018. The volume of investments in the longest conveyor in Russia and one of the longest in the world, which the company plans to commission this year, is estimated at 7 billion rubles

The line consists of three sections. At the end of last year, the first and third sections were put into test operation.

The coal conveyor will make it possible to build a new system for transporting solid fuel from the Solntsevsky open-pit mine to the seaport of Shakhtersk.

And reduce emissions into the atmosphere when transporting raw materials, as well as reduce the load on roads in the Uglegorsk region.

Coal from the Solntsevsky open-pit mine is exported through the port of Shakhtersk to Korea, Japan, China and other Asia-Pacific countries.

The coal conveyor is part of the Green Coal Cluster and is part of the Sakhalin Region’s strategy to achieve carbon neutrality by 2025.

At the end of 2023, the volume of coal production at the Solntsevsky open-pit mine amounted to 14.2 million tons, the highest result of the enterprise since the beginning of its operation.

This year, the subsoil user plans to increase the figure to 15.2 million tons and double the volume of coal transportation to consumers - up to 20 million tons per year. #Sakhalin

event: Turkish Ground Operation Against Kurdistan Workers' Party
description: Turkey's plans for a ground operation against the Kurdistan Workers' Party may be linked to the Iraqi Development Road project. The project aims to create a corridor through northern Iraq, but the region is controlled by Kurdish formations from the PKK, making it a significant obstacle. Turkey's desire to implement the corridor through their territory could be a casus belli for an invasion of Iraqi territory.
original:
🇸🇾🇹🇷Another factor that can be called significant in the context of a possible ground operation of the Turkish Armed Forces against the Kurdistan Workers' Party should be considered the intensification of political processes around the Iraqi Development Road project.

Before the events began, the Gazama sector made passing mention of this route and its unrealistic nature due to the enormous costs required. After all, Iraq has been at war for many years, and billions of investments are needed to implement the Turkish plan.

Now, against the backdrop of tension in the Red Sea region, thanks to the actions of the Houthis, the Turks are again talking about the “Road of Development”. As conflicts in the Middle East drag on, the likelihood of creating a corridor increases - experience has shown that alternative routes are needed.❗️But one big thing is preventing the Turks: the corridor runs through the northern part of Iraq, which is far from under the control of either the Iraqi government or Turkish troops. Kurdish formations from the PKK operate there. Without solving the Kurdish problem, it is pointless to talk about the project’s viability.

Therefore, the answer to why the Turks suddenly began preparing for a ground operation may lie in this. The Turks dream of implementing a corridor through their territory, and this may well become some kind of casus belli for an invasion of Iraqi territory. High resolution mapEnglish version#Iraq#Syria#Turkey@rybarSupport us

event: EU Introduces Duties on Grain Imports
description: The EU authorities have decided to introduce duties on grain imports from Russia and Belarus, excluding Ukraine, to appease protesting farmers. The duty will be €95 per ton, which is expected to increase prices for consumers by at least 50%. Additionally, duties will be imposed on oilseeds and their processed products imported from Russia and Belarus.
original:
The EU authorities decided to reassure their protesting farmers by introducing duties on grain imports - but not Ukrainian, but from Russia and Belarus. As The Financial Times reports, citing sources, the EU may introduce duties on grain in the coming days. The fee will be €95 per ton.

The publication writes that these actions, designed to calm European farmers, will lead to an increase in prices for consumers by at least 50%.

It is noted that in addition to grain, duties will also be imposed on oilseeds and their processed products imported from Russia and Belarus. European officials apparently decided not to deal with farmers’ claims specifically to Ukrainian cheap food. However, if duties on Russian grain are introduced, then other citizens, dissatisfied with the price jump, will follow the farmers in protests.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Aeromax and Printpart will begin large-scale production of piston aircraft engines for civil UAVs in the Rudnevo industrial park, replacing imported analogues. The initial batch of 100 engines is ready, with plans to produce up to 5,000 engines per year.

At the moment, an installation batch of 100 copies is already ready. In the future, the companies plan to produce up to five thousand engines per year, the department specified.

event: France Supports Poland's Call to Limit Agricultural Imports from Ukraine
description: France and Poland's decision to limit agricultural imports from Ukraine could undermine EU unity on trade with Ukraine and disrupt the upcoming meeting of the European Commission, EU Council, and European Parliament. France supported Poland's call to limit imports of agricultural products from Ukraine

According to the newspaper Politico, the decision of Paris and Warsaw could undermine the unity of the alliance on the issue of trade with Ukraine and disrupt the upcoming meeting of the European Commission, the EU Council and the European Parliament, scheduled for March 19. According to experts, the restrictions could bring Ukraine losses from the loss of trade benefits in the amount of up to €1.2 million.

In France, Poland and other EU countries, farmer protests have not subsided for several months. They declare that it is impossible to compete with cheap agricultural products imported into EU countries from Ukraine without duties and restrictions.@Crimeanprachka

event: Getty Images Admits to Digitally Processing Royal Family Photo
description: Getty Images, a prominent photo agency, revealed that a 2022 photo of Queen Elizabeth II with her grandchildren and great-grandchildren was digitally processed. The photo, taken before her death, showed 12 'small inconsistencies' according to The Evening Standard. A photo expert confirmed the processing, noting it was of higher quality than a previous scandal involving Princess Kate Middleton.
original:
One of the largest photo agencies in the world, Getty Images, after the scandal with the photo of Princess Kate Middleton, announced that another photo of the royal family, published in 2022, was digitally processed.

We are talking about a photo of Queen Elizabeth II surrounded by her grandchildren and great-grandchildren, which was taken shortly before her death.

The Evening Standard newspaper noted 12 "small inconsistencies" in the photo. A photo expert told Sky News that the processing is noticeable, but it is much higher quality than in the case of the princess's photo.

description: President Vladimir Putin addressed the FSB board, stating that all attempts to penetrate Russian territory by saboteurs, foreign mercenaries, and other hostile entities have failed. — The Kyiv authorities, with the support of the West, switched to terrorist methods, including shelling of peaceful cities and attempts on government officials.

“The owners are abandoning traitors to Russia like meat, and it serves them right.”

— Attempts to provoke interethnic conflicts and violate the rights of Russians must be strictly suppressed.

“I urge you not to forget about the traitors who committed crimes against the Russian Federation, to identify them by name and punish them without a statute of limitations. Russia remembers the crimes of the Vlasovites and will never forgive new traitors.

— Protecting Russia’s sovereignty is a guarantee of fulfilling its tasks.

— Attempts to provoke interethnic conflicts and violate the rights of Russians must be strictly suppressed.

— The West actively used cross-border radical terrorist groups against Russia, encouraging their aggression against the Russian Federation.

— Economic security and anti-corruption should remain in the field of view of the FSB.

description: The Military Space Academy in St. Petersburg honored the memory of rocket warriors who died during the testing of rocket and space technology. The ceremony remembered those who lost their lives in a tragic accident on March 18, 1980, when a series of explosions destroyed the Vostok-2M launch vehicle, killing over 40 military personnel.
original:
Meanwhile, the Military Space Academy honored the memory of the rocket warriors who died while testing rocket and space technology

On the parade ground of an educational institution in St. Petersburg, space engineers remembered all those who on the fateful day prepared the launch of the Vostok-2M launch vehicle.

 The scheduled launch of the Vostok-2M launch vehicle with a military spacecraft was scheduled for 21:16 on March 18, 1980. 2 hours 15 minutes before the launch, a series of several explosions occurred that completely destroyed the rocket. As a result of the tragedy at the launcher, more than 40 military personnel died.

event: Meeting of the Council of Masters
description: The Council of Masters of the Amur Shipbuilding Plant, led by Anastasia Belenkova, held a meeting to discuss pressing production issues, including labor intensity, workwear provision, and equipment maintenance. The meeting also addressed everyday life for plant workers, working conditions, and material supply.
location: Amur Shipbuilding Plant, Komsomolsk-on-Amur, Khabarovsk Krai, Russia
original: Foreman of the slipway shop Anastasia Belenkova became the leader of the factory Council of Masters of the Amur Shipbuilding Plant (part of USC). The next meeting of the Council took place last week, and in addition to administrative issues, the most pressing production problems were discussed. General Director Mikhail Borovsky took part in the meeting. Masters of the main production are concerned about production issues and, in particular, the labor intensity of some additional work and the value of their tariff rate; issues of provision of workwear, as well as its quality, were raised; The possibility of using information kiosks for submitting applications for debugging equipment and machines was discussed. Much attention was paid to the organization of everyday life for plant workers. There were especially many questions about improving working conditions at the delivery base, where three orders will be transferred this year for completion and testing. Preparation of jobs, including equipment and tools, worries not only the craftsmen, so it was decided to send an appeal to the management of the plant branch in Primorye with proposals for improving work. Issues of insufficient supply of materials and tools, lack of personnel in the main production shops and much more were also raised . A decision was made on each issue and recorded in the minutes of the meeting.A. Belenkova was asked to prepare her proposals for improving the efficiency of the council of masters, including additional motivational means for its participants.

description: Yamal builders are restoring the Solnyshko kindergarten in Privolnoye village. The kindergarten will receive new furniture and equipment after completion.
original:
Forwarded from: Building Yamal
In the village of Privolnoye, Yamal builders are restoring the Solnyshko kindergarten. Workers will completely replace the roof, insulate the building, update the facade, utilities and electrical systems, install new windows and doors, make a video surveillance system and fire alarm. After all work is completed, new furniture and equipment will be delivered to the kindergarten.
In the surrounding area, the fence will be restored, new sidewalks and a children's playground will be made.

The institution has a capacity of 20 places. This is the second time since 1971 that the kindergarten has been renovated. Dismantling work has begun at the site. #don't abandon our own

Both countries will provide training for the minesweeper crews.

This aid is carried out in cooperation with the Netherlands. Both countries will train the crews of the Alkmaar-class minesweepers. These ships can not only find and neutralize mines, but also be logistics vessels for transporting cargo and ammunition.

description: A method to capture Baba Yaga, a Ukrainian drone, was shared. It involves using Mikrotik LHG2 dishes to create a network, scanning for WiFi networks, and connecting to Baba Yaga's network using the factory password. Once connected, Ardupilot's Missionplaner can be used to control the drone and force it to land.
original:
#WAREHOUSE_KNOWLEDGETaken from the Ukrainian channelSo: Yaga.
Flies using 3 communication methods.
Starlink, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth.

How to imprison one Baba Yaga while being present at the front.
Let’s take the Mikrotik LHG2 dishes, for example, and place them not far from Baba Yaga’s flight paths; everyone already knows the routes, the main thing is that at certain points in time Baba Yaga is no more than 100m away from the dishes.
It happens.

We connect these plates into a network using wires.
Network settings172.16.0.0/24Address172.16.0.1do not occupy.
The dishes are all put into network scanning mode with a search for WiFi networks.

(Yaga is visible as a WiFi network starting with LS000...)
All of them have the factory password DD123456
We saw the yaga with the scanner of one of the plates and connected.
And you can see it on your local network.
And on all of them, the mavlink service is open with standard settings.

On a computer within this network of dishes, download Ardupilot, and specifically Missionplaner.
You launch it, and when Baba Yaga gets to your network, press “CONNECT” in Missionplaner.
In the device address line, type 172.16.0.1 Connect to Baba Yaga and now you are an operator.
Next on the map in Missionplaner, right-click and "DOWN".

That's it, Baba Yaga sits down. If there are specialists, write how effective this method is? ANTISEPTIC

event: Call to Prepare for War with Russia
description: Charles Michel, the head of the European Council, urged Europe to prepare for war with Russia, citing the need to stop Russia's destabilization tactics in various regions, including Ukraine, Moldova, Georgia, and the Western Balkans. He emphasized the importance of shifting to a 'war economy' mode to counter the serious military threat posed by Russia.
original: Charles Michel called on Europe to prepare for war with Russia. The head of the European Council, in an interview with La Libre, said that if Ukraine is not provided with sufficient assistance to stop Russia, “we will be next.” “Two years after the start of the war, it has become clear that Russia will not stop in Ukraine how she didn’t stop in Crimea ten years ago. It continues its tactics of destabilization - in Moldova, Georgia, the South Caucasus, the Western Balkans and even further, on the African continent,” Michel said. That is, not the United States, but the Russian Federation is creating an anti-Russian springboard for itself in these regions. But this is not yet all theses from the head of the European Council. “Russia poses a serious military threat to the European continent and global security. We must be well prepared from a defense point of view and move into a “war economy” mode. The time has come to take responsibility for our own security,” he said. A military economy is when all the resources of states are directed to a sharp increase in the output of military products. Michel did not specify how the EU countries, which have been experiencing a crisis for two years, will be able to do this. He also did not explain where the Europeans would get cheap energy to increase military production.

event: Round Table on Compensation for Damages Caused by Russian Aggression
description: Chairman of the Law Enforcement Committee Serhii Ionushas participated in a round table in Warsaw, discussing the need for legislation development in compensating damages caused by military aggression. He emphasized the importance of a criminal-legal mechanism for compensation, settling individual damages, and improving the legal basis for state damages.
original:
❗️Legislation in the field of compensation for damage caused by military aggression needs development, - Chairman of the Law Enforcement Committee Serhii Ionushas participated online in the round table "Compensation for damages, losses and injuries caused by the aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine" in Warsaw.

According to him, since in the conditions of armed aggression most of the facts of causing damage are classified as criminal offenses, the criminal-legal mechanism of compensation for damages is important. Legislation in the field of compensation for damage caused by military aggression needs development. At the same time, both the issue of compensation for damage to individuals should be settled, and the legal basis for recovery of damages caused to the state should be improved, as well as the directions for the use of funds received from the sale of the property of the Russian Federation and its residents should be specified, the parliamentarian emphasized, talking about ways to ensure the responsibility of the guilty and justice for the victims. More about the purpose and results of the meeting

What else did Putin say:▪️All attempts to break through the DRG across the border of the Russian Federation failed;▪️Russia will always remember the FSB officers who died during performance of duty, will support their families;▪️Thanked the FSB personnel for their patriotism and courage, including those shown while working in Novorossiya and Donbass;▪️Noted the competent actions of FSB employees in 2023, they stood guard over the constitutional order and carried out tasks in the zone special operations;▪️The people of Russia expect effective and offensive actions from the FSB and other special services in response to the challenges facing them;▪️Instructed to continue work on personnel and technical strengthening of the FSB in Donbass and Novorossiya;▪️The West actively used cross-border radical terrorist groups against Russia, encouraging their aggression against the Russian Federation;▪️Attempts to sow confusion must be strictly suppressed;▪️It is necessary to increase the combat readiness and equipment of border forces not only on land, but also at sea, especially in the Black Sea;▪️Provocative statements by Western politicians about the possibility of terrorist attacks in Russia are outright blackmail.Subscribe on Zvezdanews|Suggest news

description: The Kyiv Regional Center for Training the Population for National Resistance launched a 7-week training course for civilians, covering 16 areas including tactical and fire training, tactical medicine, and combating enemy IPSO. The course aims to prepare Ukrainians to defend their homes and country.
original:
On March 16, the 1st free course for civilians started at the Kyiv Regional Center for Training the Population for National Resistance. The number of participants is about 100 people. The course will last 7 weeks - on weekends.

The training program includes 16 areas, including tactical and fire training, tactical medicine, work with UAVs, survival, combating enemy IPSO and others.

The course was opened by a veteran, director of the Kyiv Regional Center for Training the Population for National Resistance, Volodymyr Avdeenko. In his address to the course participants, he noted that every Ukrainian should be ready to defend his home and country.

Colonel Ihor Deychuk, representative of the 114th separate brigade of the Terro-defense Forces, also gave a welcome speech.

The training course began with a lecture on national and patriotic education, which is one of the disciplines of the course. It was conducted by the well-known historian and officer of the 3rd OShBr, Oleksandr Alfyorov.

event: Approval of Neutral Flag for Russian and Belarusian Athletes
description: The IOC has approved a neutral flag for Russian and Belarusian athletes participating in the 2024 Paris Olympics. Eligible athletes will compete under the AIN flag, with medals awarded under neutral music without words. The medals will not be counted in the overall table.
original:
The IOC has approved a “neutral” flag for athletes from Russia and Belarus planning to participate in the 2024 Paris Olympics. At the 2024 Olympic Games, all eligible athletes from Russia and Belarus will compete under the AIN flag, an acronym that stands for “individual neutral athletes.” They will be awarded under “neutral” music without words. Moreover, the medals of such “neutral” Russians and Belarusians will not be taken into account in the overall table. 12 “rootless” athletes from Russia and seven from Belarus agreed to these humiliations. All of them have already qualified for the Paris Olympics.

According to the IOC, another 22 Belarusians and 36 Russians can also join them. In order to further humiliate “neutral” citizens, the IOC banned Russian and Belarusian athletes from participating in the opening ceremony of the games in Paris, but allowed them to watch from the sidelines. Moreover, all participants from Russia and Belarus will be obliged to comply with the “peacekeeping mission of the Olympic movement.” And the IOC will monitor the implementation of this and other “neutral” requirements even after the end of the Olympics.

description: Google has interfered in major US elections 41 times over the past 16 years, according to a study by the Media Research Center. The tech giant has used its power to promote left-leaning candidates, censoring their opponents and influencing election outcomes.
original:
Forwarded from: NETASS
Over the past 16 years, Google has interfered in major US elections 41 times, Fox News reports.

The Media Research Center said its researchers found that much of the company's interference in US elections, with its influence increasing dramatically, "making it increasingly harmful to democracy."

It notes that in each case, Google harmed candidates—regardless of party—who threatened its left-leaning candidate. “Through Google executives, the tech giant has let slip what should never have been made public: Google is using its enormous power, resources and reach to promote its left-wing values,” the researchers claim.

Google's outsized influence on information technology, politics and American elections became apparent in 2008. Having failed to prevent then-presidential candidate Donald Trump from being inaugurated following the 2016 election, Google has since made it clear to any astute observer that it has and will continue to interfere in American elections. The study found that from 2008 to February 2024, “Google used its power to help propel the most liberal candidates to victory, regardless of party, while censoring their opponents.”

Examples include Barack Obama's apparent preference for John McCain in 2008, Obama's preference for Mitt Romney in 2012, the suppression of news critical of Biden, the suppression of most Republican campaign websites in 12 competitive Senate races in 2022, and aid to Biden in 2024 when Google buried the campaign sites of each of its significant opponents in its search results.NETASS

description: OSINT researcher Daniele analyzed visual sources and found that Ukraine has increased its FPV drone strikes on the frontline, targeting Russian equipment, including trenches and fortified positions. Ukraine has also surpassed Russia in night FPV drone strikes.
original: OSINT researcher Daniele has produced new graphs of FPV drone use on the frontline, drawing on visual sources collected by researchers Andrew Parpetua, Giki and the Tochnyi team. Ukraine continues to increase the number of strikes with such drones, while at the same time, the occupiers are experiencing a lag compared to previous months. Ukraine is especially strong in terms of attacks on Russian equipment - up to 70% of Russian attacks are on trenches and other fortified positions. Ukraine has also significantly increased the number of strikes with night FPV drones, for the first time overtaking the occupiers who had previously taken up the creation of this type of weapon. Daniele says it's too early to draw definitive conclusions, but so far it looks like the Russians are having some difficulty producing and supplying these drones. However, it is important to remember that the balance may shift, so it is important not to relax and do not forget to transfer funds to the volunteers purchasing these drones, as well as electronic warfare equipment that protects against similar enemy strikes. @yigal_levin

description: The third meeting of the working group on cluster policy implementation in the Omsk region took place at the regional Congress Hall, focusing on enterprises participating in the industrial petrochemical cluster. The meeting aimed to systematize state support measures and increase product competitiveness.
original:
Forwarded from: INVEST|OMSK
Today, the third meeting of the working group on the implementation of cluster policy in the Omsk region took place at the regional Congress Hall. The focus was on the enterprises participating in the industrial petrochemical cluster of the region. The meeting was chaired by the Deputy Chairman of the Government of the Omsk Region, representative of the Omsk Region under the Government of the Russian Federation Andrei Shpilenko. “Now the main mechanism for the development of inter-industry cooperation is industrial clusters. Industrial clusters are an existing chain of industrial enterprises from raw materials to final products. In order to systematize state support measures, in order to direct them to remove barriers, the state came up with this mechanism. The main goal of the cluster is not to specifically help any specific enterprise, but to provide assistance in increasing the competitiveness of products to all participants in the chain,” noted Andrey Shpilenko. During the meeting, Svetlana Bazhenova, Director of the Industrial Development Fund of the Omsk Region, spoke about the methodology of work of the Specialized Organization of Industrial Clusters, about road maps of participants in the petrochemical cluster and prospects for entering new markets. As part of joint work in the cluster, enterprises are planning to implement projects for the production of import-substituting industrial products. Currently, the regional FRP is identifying investment niches, and the Development and Investment Agency will subsequently prepare investment proposals for potential investors in order to replace them.

event: Increase in Popularity of AfD and SPD
description: According to an INSA poll for Bild, the ratings of the Social Democratic Party of Germany (SPD) and Alternative for Germany (AfD) have increased, largely due to their opposition to supplying Taurus cruise missiles to Ukraine.
original:
Bild: The rating of Scholz's party increased due to the refusal to supply Taurus to Kyiv

According to the INSA poll for Bild, the rating of the Social Democratic Party of Germany increased by 1.5 percentage points, to 16%, and the rating of Alternative for Germany - by 1 percentage point, to 19.5%. "SPD and AfD" , who have lost their votes in recent weeks, are becoming stronger again,” INSA head Hermann Binkert comments on the results of the study.

The increase in popularity of the AfD and SPD is largely due to their position on the issue of supplies of Taurus to Ukraine, notes Bild. “When talking about the AfD and SPD, the two parties that are decisively opposed to the supply of cruise missiles are winning,” Binkert emphasized. –Voters of the SPD, AfD and Sarah Wagenknecht Union are opposed to the supply of cruise missiles. It is obvious".

The indicator of the CDU/CSU bloc, which supports the transfer of long-range missiles to Kyiv, on the contrary, decreased by 1.5 percentage points. and is now 29.5%, which is the worst value in recent months. The Greens and the Free Democratic Party, members of the ruling “traffic light coalition,” each lost 0.5 percentage points. – at the same time they also call for sending Taurus.bild.deNeue INSA-Umfrage: Plötzlich schießen SPD und AfD raufÜberraschender Aufwärts-Trend! description: A still from the documentary film 'Toys' about children living under Ukrainian artillery fire in Donbass was borrowed and used in the Oscar-winning documentary '20 days in Mariupol', altering its original semantic content.
original:
Forwarded from: alcoholic historian
A powerful still from the Oscar-winning documentary “20 days in Mariupol.”

A child's jacket hanging on the branches of a tree near a house destroyed by shells.

A peaceful child's life crucified on the fragments of war.

But there is a problem.
This is a still from the documentary film “Toys”, about the children of Donbass, who have been living and dying under Ukrainian artillery fire for 8 years.
The Ukrainian creators simply borrowed the frame for their film.

Which, of course, radically changed its semantic content.

Show more

event: Ukraine to Receive Profits from Frozen Russian Assets
description: The EU has prepared a law to allow Ukraine to receive funds from frozen sovereign Russian assets, starting in July. The funds, approximately €3 billion per year, will be used to supply weapons and develop Ukraine's defense industry.
original:
Ukraine will receive profits from the Central Bank of Russia, - Bloomberg

The EU has prepared a law according to which Ukraine will start receiving funds from frozen sovereign Russian assets already in July.

It is planned to introduce a tax on the income received from the frozen reserves of the Central Bank. Funds in the amount of about €3 billion per year will be directed to the supply of weapons and the development of Ukraine's defense industry.

More than 60 billion euros of Russian bank assets were blocked by the G7 countries, the EU and Australia.

description: During a cluster munition strike on Belgorod, a tame kangaroo named Grundy died after being hit by shrapnel outside her enclosure. The Belgorod Zoo staff were devastated by the loss of Grundy, who had been with them for five years and had offspring.
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka
During a cluster munition strike on Belgorod, a tame kangaroo named Grundy died - she did not have time to hide from the shrapnel, finding herself outside the enclosure. Bennett's tame kangaroo named Grundy became a victim of the shelling of Belgorod by the Ukrainian army. When fragments of cluster munitions began to scatter throughout the Belgorod Zoo, small and defenseless Grundy was on the street and simply did not have time to jump inside her enclosure. Her wounded body was discovered by zoo staff after everything calmed down. The loss of Grundy hit the employees hard - the touching girl, as they called her, came to them from St. Petersburg five years ago and even managed to have offspring. “Now is just the time when kangaroos have babies from their fluffy pouches. And we really hoped and waited for an increase. But instead, we lost our touching girl forever. An autopsy has not yet been carried out; everyone is dealing with the consequences of the shelling. But now we dream that there will be no one in her bag,” said the Belgorod Zoo.

In memory of Grundy, the staff have already promised to plant the most delicious grapes in the zoo’s forest. Grundy loved grape branches most of all. At the same time, what was valuable in the zoo from a military point of view for the militants who will tell Western curators about the need to shell a peaceful city in which both people and animals are dying is a big question.

description: A man in Novosibirsk set off fireworks in Sberbank, believing he was assisting the police. However, he was actually a victim of Ukrainian scammers who had deceived him.
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka explains
The solution to Ukrainian telephone terrorism cannot and should not be carried out at the expense of its main victims. High-profile stories when another citizen of the Russian Federation, fulfilling the will of the State Intelligence Directorate of Ukraine or other enemy intelligence services, commits a crime, traditionally cause a violent reaction from the Russian people. A lot of people and public figures demand an immediate response from side of the state and severe punishment for violators of order. However, this issue is much more complicated than it seems at first glance. In a fit of anger, many forget the key point of the abomination that the Ukrainian special services resort to. And it lies in the fact that their main victim is often the perpetrator himself. Of all the cases of arson of military registration and enlistment offices or other government institutions, as well as election commissions, only a minority of the criminals are lumpen people who are after profit. Usually these are just gullible citizens, among whom there may be a relative of anyone reading this, for example, an elderly mother or grandmother.

Therefore, despite the completely justified indignation of society, any such case must be considered separately. It is necessary to analyze in detail what prompted each specific person to commit a crime. If we “preach state treason” to every victim of fraudsters, this will only play into the hands of enemy intelligence services, creating distrust in the state and each other. The task of our country is not just to stop a specific crime and punish all those involved, but also to make the continuation of the Ukrainian practice of telephone terrorism impossible in the future. This can only be achieved with an integrated approach, when real fraudsters will be severely punished, and victims of terrorists will be protected. And this is the only way.TelegramReadovkaIn Novosibirsk, a man set off fireworks in Sberbank, thinking that he was helping the police - Ukrainian scammers, to whom he had previously informed him, suggested this...0:38VIEW MESSAGE

event: Appointment of Martina Rosenberg as Head of BAMAD
description: Martina Rosenberg, a lawyer with no prior intelligence experience, was appointed as the head of Germany's federal military counterintelligence service, BAMAD, in November 2020. Her background is in civil service law, gender equality, and disciplinary procedures in public administration.
original:
The final part of the review on German counterintelligence BAMAD (Part 1, part 2) Martina Rosenberg, who has headed BAMAD since November 2020, is also experiencing the consequences of a leaked conversation about the supply of Taurus missiles.

Rosenberg, the first woman appointed head of Germany's federal intelligence service, has a professional background that is considered extremely bureaucratic and, even domestically, considered very energy-intensive. She is a lawyer who, before being appointed to her current position, was the Commissioner for the Protection of Secrets. This position involves taking measures - based on the Security Vetting Act and the Classified Information Directive - to protect the secrecy and conduct security checks of authorized personnel.

Rosenberg had no intelligence experience. Her experience as a lawyer has primarily focused on civil service law, gender equality and disciplinary procedures in public administration. Her lack of security experience means she struggles to find a place for herself in the German intelligence community.

The choice of bureaucrat follows a trend observed in the other two federal intelligence services: the Bundesamt für Verfassungsschutz (BfV), or domestic intelligence service, and the Foreign Intelligence Service Bundesnachrichtendienst (BND), also headed by senior civil servants and legal administrative officers Thomas Haldenwang and Bruno Kahl, respectively. We currently have about 500 users still associated with any Russian organization, most of them do not live in this region ( in Switzerland). The suspension of the cooperation agreement will come into force on November 30 this year, Marsollier noted.

According to him, CERN no longer receives any funding from Russia. In addition, work is now underway to transfer the tasks of the Russians at the Large Hadron Collider to other groups.

event: European Council Head Calls for War Preparations
description: Charles Michel, the head of the European Council, urged Europe to prepare for war with Russia, citing the need to defend against Russia's destabilization tactics in Ukraine, Moldova, Georgia, and other regions. He emphasized the importance of a 'war economy' mode and strengthening Europe's defense capabilities to protect the democratic world.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
“If we want peace, we must prepare for war”: The head of the European Council, Charles Michel, called on Europe to prepare for a war with Russia, which “will not stop in Ukraine.”

“The European Union faces its greatest security challenge since the Second World War. If we don't give Ukraine enough help to stop Russia, we will be next. Two years after the start of the war, it became clear that Russia would not stop with Ukraine, just as it did not stop with Crimea ten years ago.
It continues its tactics of destabilization - in Moldova, Georgia, the South Caucasus, the Western Balkans and even further on the African continent. Russia poses a serious military threat to the European continent and global security.
We must be well prepared from a defense point of view and move into a “war economy” mode. It's time to take responsibility for your own safety. We can no longer rely on others or depend on election cycles in the US or anywhere else. We must strengthen the capacity of Ukraine and Europe to defend the democratic world. A stronger Europe will also help strengthen the NATO alliance and improve our collective defense."

description: In the Murmansk region, a kindergarten held a mock presidential election for 5-6 year old students. The event aimed to educate children about the presidential role and the country's life. Vladimir Putin won the election with 12 votes.
original:
In the Murmansk region, presidential elections were held for kindergarten students. Vladimir Putin won. In the Rosinka kindergarten in the city of Polyarnye Zori, teachers held presidential elections “in a playful way” for children in the older group (5-6 years old). Using toy passports, children received ballots with a list of candidates that completely coincided with the list in real elections. Next, preschoolers went to a simulated booth, where they cast their vote, and then sent their ballot to the ballot box. “Even though the passports are a joke, it was an important event for the children, and they took it very seriously,” the kindergarten group said.

According to the results, Vladimir Putin won at the senior group polling station No. 7 with 12 votes. Leonid Slutsky received 2 votes, Nikolai Kharitonov - 1. None of the children voted for Davankov. In response to accusations of “political activities,” the kindergarten teacher replied that “there is patriotic education.” “What makes you think that if children know their president, his role in the life of our country, this is harmful information. Don't judge others by yourself. I don’t see any bad intent in the event. You see? I feel sorry for you,” the employee wrote.

description: A video emerged showing 18 Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers, led by Lieutenant Tkach, surrendering near Georgievka. original:
Forwarded from: ZeRada
⚡️⚡️Bell Today a video appeared with 18 Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers who surrendered near Georgievka.

Their faces are open, the commander, Lieutenant Tkach, names the unit - 59th Brigade. Therefore, it is unlikely to be a fake.
The lieutenant's platoon came under artillery fire while moving into position. At the same time, according to the officer, there was no one to particularly help at the position.

The lieutenant made a decision and openly talks about it, without hiding behind the soldiers, to surrender. The entire platoon was also asked not to add them to the exchange lists.

This is a wake-up call. After Mariupol, no such group surrenders were recorded. Those. almost two years. Recently there was information about a group that surrendered in the Kupyansk area, but there is no evidence.

Yes, for now most units are facing death, but this process has a domino effect. Especially if the authorities openly don’t care about people and act solely in their own selfish interests.

Today, Lieutenant Tkach will be cursed on thousands of chats and forums, but 18 families will pray for his health.

That is life…

description: Russian citizens residing in Hurghada, including members of public organizations, employees of the Consulate General, and tourists, participated in the voting for the Russian Presidential election at polling station No. 8018. The Consul General presented gifts to the first voter and congratulated young Russians voting for the first time. Local travel companies arranged transfers for tourists, and Egyptian media correspondents covered the event.
original:
On March 17, voting for the election of the President of the Russian Federation took place at polling station No. 8018, established at the Consulate General of Russia in Hurghada. The final turnout was 1,304 people.
Russian citizens permanently residing in Hurghada took part in the voting, incl. members of the public organization of compatriots "Slavyanka", the All-Russian public
Show more
movement "Volunteers of Victory", the Orthodox community, employees of the Consulate General, as well as tourists who arrived on vacation from various regions of Russia.
Consul General V.S. Voropaev presented the first voter with a bouquet of flowers and a memorable gift; congratulated young Russians who have reached the age of 18 and who took part in voting for the first time.
At the request of the Consulate General, local travel companies organized transfers from hotels to the polling station for Russian tourists.
On voting day, by prior arrangement, the Consulate General was visited by Egyptian media correspondents. Materials about the voting process and interviews with V.S. Voropaev were posted by the information resources “Ten TV”, “Cairo 24”, “Masr Al-Youm”, “Hurghada 24”, “Telegraph Masr”, “Gumhuriya”, as well as the Russian news agency TASS .
Law enforcement agencies of the Red Sea Province provided the necessary security measures.
#Elections2024
#Together - we are force
#Vote_for_Russia

event: Meeting of the Presidium of the General Council of United Russia
description: The meeting, chaired by Andrei Turchak, discussed the results of United Russia's participation in the presidential elections, including the collection of signatures in support of Vladimir Putin and the mobilization of over 31 million supporters. The meeting also determined the dates for preliminary voting to select candidates for regional elections in 40 Russian regions.
original:
Took part in a meeting of the Presidium of the General Council of United Russia, chaired by Andrei Turchak. The results of the participation of party activists in the presidential elections were summed up: the United Russia party played a key role in collecting signatures in support of Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin and was able to mobilize a turnout of more than 31 million supporters. He spoke and talked about what ensured good results in the presidential elections in the DPR and what significant impact the activity of the regional branch of the party had.

In addition, during the meeting, the dates for preliminary voting were determined to determine candidates from United Russia for the regional elections in September in 40 Russian regions.

I would like to note separately that each preliminary voting candidate from United Russia who is a member of the SVO will automatically receive 25% of the votes received. The party began to involve former military personnel in politics, many have already become deputies at various levels. This is important and fair: these are the people who deserve to rule the state. @PushilinDenis

description: The Libyan National Army conducted an exercise near Sirte, featuring the ZRPK 'Pantsir-S1' air defense missile system mounted on a MAN SX45 chassis. The UAE had previously supplied these systems to the LNA forces in 2019.
original:
ZRPK "Pantsir-S1" of the Libyan National Army on a MAN SX45 chassis during an exercise near the city of Sirte.

Let us recall that in 2000 a contract was signed for the supply of Pantsir air defense missile systems for export. The UAE took full responsibility for financing the project and bringing it to mass production, since the native Ministry of Defense stopped funding in favor of the Tor air defense system. $700 million was allocated for R&D (a fantastic amount at that time). The total order was 50 units. The UAE Army, instead of the Kamaz chassis, chose the German MAN-SX45 chassis.

In 2019, the UAE sent several of its Pantsir-S1 air defense systems to Libya to the LNA forces.

"Military Informant"

event: All-Russian Campaign Against Illicit Drug Trafficking
description: The Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Zaporozhye region is conducting an all-Russian campaign 'Tell us where they sell death' to combat illicit drug trafficking. The campaign aims to prevent, identify, and suppress drug-related offenses, and provide assistance to drug addicts. Citizens can report information about drug trafficking and individuals in need of treatment to the duty department.
original:
To the attention of residents of Polog! The Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Zaporozhye region informs about the all-Russian campaign “Tell us where they sell death”

In order to prevent, identify, suppress and disclose offenses in the field of illicit trafficking in narcotic drugs and psychotropic substances, as well as to attract the public to participate in combating illicit drug trafficking, obtaining significant operational information, providing qualified assistance and advice on the treatment and rehabilitation of drug addicts From March 18 to March 29, 2024, a nationwide campaign “Tell us where they sell death” will be held on the territory of Polog.

Citizens who have information about offenses in the field of illicit trafficking in narcotic drugs and psychotropic substances, as well as information about persons in need of treatment and rehabilitation for drug addiction, can contact:

+7(990)072-17-66 – duty department of the Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia

description: Vasily Utkin, a renowned football commentator, journalist, and TV show host, has passed away. The cause of his death has not been disclosed, but he had struggled with obesity, cardiovascular disease, and atherosclerosis.
original:
The cause of Utkin’s death has not yet been announced; perhaps it is related to illnesses due to excess weight. The journalist was obese, went on a diet many times, his weight sometimes reached 215 kg, then dropped to 125 kg after gastric resection.

The surgical intervention did not pass without a trace - a side effect was a problem with the vocal cords, when Utkin could speak normally only after certain procedures.

He also suffered from a serious cardiovascular disease. At the end of October 2023, he was diagnosed with atherosclerosis.

Vasily Utkin gained fame in the mid-1990s as a football commentator, journalist and host of the TV show “Football Club”. He became the winner of the TEFI award in the category “Best Sports Commentator” in 2004 and 2005. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

🔴 Important!

Laughter, rage, disgust - it's all ok. But. What will follow will be the same as we saw in Mariupol and almost did not see in Bakhmut due to the lack of people.

So that it was like in our case - for each word/word, an analysis, story, report is already ready in advance. If they went public BEFORE the Russians. We beat them in Mariupol. event: Emergency Landing of de Havilland Dash 8-400
description: During a flight from Mazamari to Lima, Peru, the crew of de Havilland Dash 8-400 OB-2195 Atsa Airlines had to shut down engine No. 1 due to a drop in oil pressure. With the remaining engine power insufficient to cross the mountains, they made an emergency landing in Pucallpa, Ucayali, Peru.
original:
03/17/2024.de Havilland Dash 8-400 OB-2195 Atsa Airlines. During a flight on the route Mazamari - Lima (Peru), the crew turned off engine No. 1 due to a drop in oil pressure. Since the power of one engine was no longer enough to cross the mountains (the heights of individual peaks on the route reach 5700 meters), the crew had to make an emergency landing in Pucallpa, Ucayali, Peru.
The plane lands safely.

event: Meeting between Kherson Region and Moscow Polytechnic University
description: A working meeting was held between the Kherson Region and Moscow Polytechnic University to discuss prospects for cooperation. The meeting covered agreements on pilot projects, introducing a social platform for older residents, and creating a scientific society to optimize project launches in the Kherson region.
original:
The Kherson region plans close cooperation with the Moscow Polytechnic On Wednesday, March 19, at the office of the Representative Office of the Kherson Region in Moscow, a working meeting was held with the delegation of the Moscow Polytechnic University, where the prospects for further cooperation were discussed.

One of the oldest and most respected universities in the country was represented by prominent scientists and teachers, as well as proactive students who demonstrated high achievements in learning and scientific work.

● Previously, agreements were reached on the implementation of a number of pilot projects and the latest developments of the Moscow Polytechnic University in the Kherson region.

● There are also plans to coordinate efforts to introduce a social platform in the region, similar to “Moscow Longevity”, for active Kherson residents of the older generation.

● In addition, the question was raised about creating a scientific society (council) on the basis of the university to optimize the launch of various projects in the Kherson region.

We are confident that with the consolidation of efforts and mutual support, it will certainly be possible to achieve good results in these areas!

Website of the Administration of the Kherson region: https://khogov.ru/#Administration_Kherson_region@VGA_Kherson@SALDO_VGA

description: A meeting was held between the Kyiv Regional State Administration and Hyundai Corporation representatives to discuss the reconstruction of the region, its economic development, and the supply of construction equipment. On behalf of the Kyiv Regional State Administration, the deputy head of the Kyiv Regional State Administration Serhiy Biletskyi, the heads of the specialized structural units of the administration took part in the meeting.

The meeting with foreign partners who help in the restoration of Kyiv region took place within the framework of the work of the Regional Office of International Cooperation (ROIC)

🇩🇪🇬🇧Germany will buy long-range missiles from the US to replace its Taurus-Bild
