description: The 17th issue of Rybara Comics, dedicated to fearless ATGM operators, was released. The comic aims to boost morale and inspire bold tactical decisions among Russian soldiers. It tells the story of guard corporal Evgeny Kim, who serves in the Northern Military District, driven by love for the Motherland.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
⚡️🇷🇺🇺🇦🖍 #Rybara Comics No. 17: Once Upon a Time near Konstantinovka The seventeenth issue, dedicated to the fearless ATGM operators smashing NATO vehicles along the entire front, probably turned out to be one of the most fun.

Which we are sincerely glad about, because humor, camp stories and military passion among soldiers are integral components for raising morale and the emergence of bold tactical decisions, which often achieve outstanding victories of Russian units. Synopsis: On the fronts of the Northern Military District, different people are fighting shoulder to shoulder - originally from from different cities and villages, different ages, with different life experiences. Together they carry out combat missions and are ready to help each other out in difficult times, which is never superfluous at the front.

Our hero, guard corporal, Evgeny Kim, shortly before the start of the Northern Military District, completed military service and entered into a contract with the Russian Armed Forces. In January 2022, being at home on vacation, he did not know what awaited him very soon in the service.

But no matter what happens, the senior operator of the Kornet installation is ready to take the fight, help his comrades in arms, and complete all tasks - and not for the sake of awards and orders. Like most military personnel in the Northern Military District zone, he is driven by love for the Motherland.📌You can download the comic using the links: RU|EN|CN|ARP.S. Special thanks to @rvkoteam, who centrally print and distribute our comics among military personnel on the front line. #Russia#Ukraine@rybarWe hope you liked the comic from our artists. We will be glad to receive any support (here is a convenient link to payment via SBP).

description: The SBU detained a Russian intelligence informant in Mykolaiv Oblast who was using drones to spy on the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The informant, a former employee of a local defense plant, was passing information to a Russian special service liaison in Crimea. The Russians planned to use the intel to prepare sabotage and missile attacks on Ukrainian air defense systems.
original:
The SBU detained a Russian intelligence informant who was spying on the Armed Forces in Mykolaiv Oblast with the help of drones. The attacker tried to identify the combat positions of the air defense complexes of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

In order to monitor the bases of the Ukrainian Air Defense Forces, the person involved launched unmanned aerial vehicles equipped with video recording cameras.

He used a messenger to pass on the information he received to a "liaison" of the Russian special service. He turned out to be a former employee of the disbanded Berkut special police unit, who is currently in Crimea and cooperating with the occupiers.

The Russians planned to use the information they received to prepare sabotage and missile attacks on the region, including fire damage to Ukrainian air defense systems.

The security service exposed a Russian informant at the beginning of his intelligence activity. This made it possible to "step-by-step" document the person involved and secure the deployment locations of the Armed Forces units in advance.

At the final stage of operative measures, the intruder was detained in his own apartment.

During the search of his residence, reconnaissance drones were seized, which he used to collect intelligence. Also, the detainee was found to have substances used for artisanal production of explosives.

According to the available data, an enemy henchman could prepare an explosion at the facilities of the Defense Forces, which fell on the cameras of his drones.

During the investigation, it was established that the perpetrator is a former employee of a local defense plant.

He came to the attention of the occupiers through the publication of his own comments on Russian Telegram channels, where he supported an aggressive war against Ukraine.

So far, investigators of the Security Service have notified the detainee of suspicion under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

The perpetrator is in custody. He faces up to 12 years in prison.

description: China plans to import a record 1.7 million barrels of oil from Russia in March, primarily consisting of Sokol and ESPO oil. This shift is attributed to tightening US sanctions and disagreements over payment currencies, leading India to relinquish its position as the main consumer of these oil brands.
original:
Change of direction?: China plans to import about 1.7 million barrels of oil from Russia in March, which will be a record. The increase in supplies is expected to be ensured by Sokol oil from the fields of the Sakhalin-1 project and ESPO oil, which is transported via the Vostochnaya oil trunk pipeline Siberia-Pacific Ocean and is supplied to China directly via the Skovorodino-Mohe oil pipeline or shipped for export by sea through the port of Kozmino. It is also worth mentioning that the main consumer of these brands until recently was India. This is due to tightening sanctions and control by the United States over compliance with the price ceiling, as well as disagreements with the Russian side regarding the currency of payments. As a result, the PRC seized the initiative and took the surplus for itself.

It is not for nothing that Russia and China constantly talk about rapprochement, especially against the backdrop of changes in global trade chains. It can be assumed that record supplies of Sokol and ESPO varieties will be redirected to other countries, which will seem like a completely logical decision. However, we should also not forget that the issue of mutual settlements still remains acute, as can be clearly seen in the example of Moscow and New Delhi. One of the reasons for changing the trade route can be called not sanctions, but precisely the difficulties that have arisen when paying for goods - Indian currency is difficult to convert, which is why problems arise with money transfers and discounts. As a result, the Indian government decided not to torture itself and its partner, which may have led to a new unspoken agreement between the BRICS members, the implementation of which could become one of the foundations of a new world market. That is why, let us assume that the change of buyer will not affect the existing agreements in any way in the long term.@kstati_pOil PriceChina Poised to Import Record-High Crude Oil Volumes From RussiaChina is set to import record high volumes of Russian oil in March as it mops up cargoes shunned byIndia.

description: Anna Skupkova, the head of the administration of the Krasnensky rural settlement, was involved in a serious car accident with a GAZelle on March 18. location: Rostov-Volgodonsk highway, Bagaevsky district, Rostov Oblast, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: DonDay | Rostov News
❗️In the Rostov region, doctors are fighting for the life of the head of the administration of the Krasnensky rural settlement❗️Anna Skupkova, driving a Hyundai Solaris, got into a serious accident with a GAZelle on March 18.

At about 10:00, the official was driving along the road that connects the village of Pervomaisky with the Krasny farm in the Bagaevsky district. According to the regional State Traffic Safety Inspectorate, when entering the Rostov-Volgodonsk highway, she did not yield to the 39-year-old driver of a light-duty truck. The GAZelle rammed the car at full speed.

The foreign car was seriously damaged, and the driver was injured. Ambulance officers arrived at the scene and took Anna to the hospital.

According to DonDay's source, the 35-year-old woman was taken to the Aksai district central district hospital. She is in intensive care.

Anna Skupkova has been holding the position of head of the administration of the Krasnensky rural settlement of the Bagaevsky district of the Rostov region for more than two years. She was appointed to the post in October 2021.

description: Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia, A.Yu. Rudenkos, and China's special representative for Korean Peninsula affairs, Liu Xiaoming, held consultations in Moscow. They discussed the escalating tensions around the Korean Peninsula, attributing it to the dangerous military activities of US allies. They emphasized the need for Washington to adopt a responsible approach, abandoning Cold War mentality, and instead focus on political and diplomatic solutions to ensure lasting peace and stability in the region.
original:
🇷🇺🇨🇳On March 18 in Moscow, consultations were held between the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation A.Yu. Rudenkos and the special representative of the Government of the People's Republic of China for the affairs of the Korean Peninsula, Liu Xiaoming. The parties, having substantively discussed the emerging situation around the Korean Peninsula, noted that the reason for the current escalation of tensions is the dangerous military activity of the United States allies, which threatens the security of all countries in Northeast Asia.

The need was emphasized for Washington to abandon bloc thinking in the spirit of the Cold War and take a responsible approach to solving the problems of the subregion exclusively through political and diplomatic means. This should be confirmed by practical steps by the American side to reduce tensions in the interests of ensuring lasting peace and stability in the region based on the principle of indivisible security. Russia and China agreed to continue to coordinate joint efforts and strengthen strategic interaction bilaterally and at international platforms, primarily the UN. #KoreanPeninsula

The Federal Security Service of Russia in the Altai Territory suppressed the illegal terrorist activities of a local resident, born in 1976.

A ninth-grader from Moscow received death threats for winning the Miss School competition. On March 12, a beauty contest was held at school No. 1371. The day after her victory, the 15-year-old schoolgirl was bombarded with insults from another participant. The girl did not respond to the provocations and told her mother about the insults.

Then the angry teenagers created a group where they threw mud at the winner, published her address and threatened to kill her. The schoolgirl showed the screenshots to her parents, and her father filed a statement with the police.

The threatening girls were quickly found; it turned out that they were students of the same school. According to them, they were joking. description: The American Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) published a report on Mongolia, suggesting that the US should invest more in the country to counterbalance Russian and Chinese influence. The report highlights Mongolia's valuable resources, including fluorspar, and proposes a more flexible approach to investment.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
🇺🇸🇲🇳The American Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS), in the context of its Asian program, published an interesting note about Mongolia.

We have already repeatedly told how Western countries actively seized influence in the republic, which is why there is a strong impression that the Mongols are destined for the “Ukrainian scenario.”

The CSIS article explicitly notes that the United States should invest more in Mongolia for at least several reasons: To “overwhelm” the authority of Russia and China: experts suggest that investing in the republic would be a “pleasant opportunity for America’s financial agencies.” We all know very well how these opportunities usually end for statehood, sovereignty and, in general, the fate of the nation.🔻To take possession of valuable resources. Analysts directly emphasize that Mongolia ranks third in the world in the production of fluorspar (10% of the world's volume, excluding the States), which is included in the list of essential minerals by the US Department of Energy.

There’s just one problem: Mongolia’s legislation, its ties with the Russian Federation and the People’s Republic of China make the country quite “risky for investment.” But if we could influence the authorities a little so that they would adopt the necessary strategy and laws, then investors would immediately run to invest money. It is quite obvious that in Washington they directly tell the Mongolian authorities what and how to do in order to get the opportunity to become a “favorite Asian wife” . However, history has repeatedly proven that such a role is reserved only for those countries that are willing to sacrifice not only state sovereignty, but also national identity. Economic EngagementCSIS expert Erin Murphy proposes that U.S. financing agencies should pursue a more flexible approach to investment in strategic middle powers such as Mongolia.

Russians of the highest standard: in Ukraine, a family was arrested for burying the remains of our soldiers. In the Kyiv region, according to the local press, a family was arrested. description: A survey of 35 influential investors in Morocco's financial market revealed that 98% expect Bank Al-Maghrib to maintain its benchmark interest rate at 3%. This confidence stems from easing inflation, which rose 2.4% in January 2024, indicating economic recovery.
original:
🇲🇦Investors expect Bank Al-Maghrib's benchmark interest rate to remain stable The vast majority of financial investors in Morocco are confident that Morocco's central bank, Bank Al-Maghrib (BAM), will keep its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 3%.

In a recent survey conducted by Attijari Global Research among 35 influential investors in the Moroccan financial market, a staggering 98% of respondents agreed with the scenario of leaving the benchmark interest rate unchanged.

The survey, conducted ahead of BAM's first monetary policy meeting on March 19, 2024, indicates a high likelihood of base rate stability.

High market confidence that interest rates will remain stable is also a result of easing inflation. Inflation rose just 2.4% at the end of January 2024, a strong sign of economic recovery after inflation averaged 6.1% at the end of 2023.

With external pressures likely to continue to ease throughout 2024, inflation in Morocco is likely to continue to decline further, to an average of 2.3% in 2024, approaching the recommended level of 2%.Morocco World NewsInvestors Expect Bank Al -Maghrib's Benchmark Interest Rate to Remain StableAn overwhelming majority of financial investors in Morocco are confident that Morocco's central bank, Bank Al-Maghrib (BAM), will maintain the benchma...

description: MMA fighter Ali Heibati is set to face Artem Tarasov in an upcoming fight. Heibati has a personal vendetta against Tarasov, who previously fought and lost to his brother, Mohammed. Tarasov continued to insult the brothers after the fight, fueling Heibati's desire for revenge.
original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
“I grew up as a fighter and I’m just going to destroy him,” MMA fighter Ali Heibati commented on his upcoming fight with Artem Tarasov.

Heibati said that his personal conflict with his future rival began two years ago. Then the blogger called out Heibati’s brother, Mohammed, for a fight. “He started with my brother two years ago, got a fight with him, my brother just destroyed him for 15 minutes. After that, we thought that he would calm down, but he began to humiliate my brother after the fight ", Heibati said. A year later, the fight between Ali and Tarasov ended in the defeat of the second. However, according to Heibati, the story did not end there—Tarasov continued to insult the brothers. The tournament will be held in the format of “three rounds of three minutes each.” You can purchase tickets for the tournament "Fight Club REN TV. Super Series. description: The Donetsk People's Republic is participating in the all-Russian competition 'From the Southern Seas to the Polar Region' with 5 attractions that hold symbolic meaning for Donbass residents. original:

The Donetsk People's Republic presented 5 significant points of attraction to the Competition, which have a symbolic meaning for the residents of Donbass:

1. Landscape and recreational park “Zuevsky”.
2. Memorial complex "Saur - Mogila".
3. Monument “To your liberators, Donbass!”
4. Holy place of the village of Konkovo.
5. Park of forged figures.

Based on the results of the voting, the top 30 locations will be formed, which in 2025 are planned to be included in the tourist routes of the “More than a Travel” program. Support the places of pride of the Donetsk People's Republic and take part in the open voting of places of pride.rf.

In addition, each resident of the region has the opportunity to propose their own “place of power”, which will become part of the gallery of attractions. You can familiarize yourself with the rules of participation in the competition on the Competition website.

TelegramTASS❗️France is already preparing a contingent to be sent to Ukraine, at the initial stage it will amount to about 2,000 military personnel, Naryshkin said. Ukraine can add that from a military point of view it is not necessary to transfer thousands of people with equipment - at first they will be able to limit themselves to modest forces to demonstrate their presence.

From the same military point of view, nothing prevents France from deploying forces in areas remote from the LBS, including right near the border with Romania. In the latter case, air cover can formally be provided from the territory of a NATO member state, without bringing air defense systems to the so-called. Ukraine.

But even in such a scenario, any objects of the Fifth Republic in areas controlled by the Ukrainian Armed Forces will still become the subject of increased interest on the part of Russian troops in terms of both information about them and the allocated ammunition consumption.

And this is not to mention the fact that in the ranks of the RF Armed Forces the appearance of the so-called. In Ukraine, those same NATO soldiers will cause a certain stir. He had a notable playing career, representing the Belarusian national team at the 2002 and 2010 Olympics, playing for Pittsburgh in the NHL, and winning the Russian championship and Gagarin Cup with Salavat.
original:
The coach of the Ufa hockey club "Salavat Yulaev" Konstantin Koltsov died at the age of 42, the club reports.

Koltsov played for the Belarusian national team at the 2002 and 2010 Olympics, played for Pittsburgh in the NHL, and with Salavat he became the champion of Russia and the winner of the Gagarin Cup.

description: Ukraine attended the Ramstein meeting, where they agreed on the supply of artillery, air defense, missiles, and other necessary equipment. Minister of Defense Umerov stated that the supplies would begin within 15 days, but the exact numbers remain unclear.
original:
#layout The twentieth anniversary of Rammstein passed without any clear victories for the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the case of increasing arms supplies. A downward trend is clearly visible. They give less and less, but they promise more and more.

The statement by Minister of Defense Umerov is vague, since there are no clear “numbers”. I had to say publicly that everything would be ready and that it would be sent soon. At Ramstein, Ukraine agreed on the supply of artillery, air defense, missiles and what we most need now. The unloading of all this will begin in the near future, within 15 days, - Umerov. In fact, the request remained the same as last time, we were informed about it. The next meeting will also most likely be held under the same conditions and requests. Ukraine will increasingly have to fight only with infantry.

event: Discussion of New Coat of Arms for Kazakhstan
description: The Minister of Finance, Madi Takiev, commented on the potential renewal of Kazakhstan's coat of arms. He emphasized that the costs of this activity have not been estimated yet and that a decision has not been made. The minister stated that a preliminary design is needed and that the process requires careful consideration.
original:
Forwarded from: ORDA
The Minister of Finance commented on the renewal of the coat of arms of Kazakhstan. The costs of this activity have not yet been estimated, noted Madi Takiev. “Let’s first decide whether it needs to be changed. You yourself know very well that you haven’t made a decision yet. It was said: if society supports it, then we will consider the issue and create a commission. We need a preliminary design; we can’t just change the coat of arms today. This is a lot of work: we need to calculate everything...” the minister noted. Let us recall that Tokayev raised the issue of a new coat of arms at the kurultai in Atyrau.t.me/orda_kz

Former British Defense Secretary Ben Wallace said that a scenario in which British troops would have to participate in the war in Ukraine “cannot be ruled out,” the Daily Mail reports.

He also called for setting a minimum level of defense spending at 3% of GDP.

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces shelled the Belgorod region, targeting residential buildings and cars. Footage shows a crater in a courtyard, shattered windows, and cars riddled with bullets. Some private houses are still burning. Rescuers are working at the emergency sites, but there is no official information on casualties yet.
original:
Footage from the Belgorod region, which was shelled this morning - right in the courtyard of a residential building there is a gaping crater from a shell, and in some cars and premises all the windows were knocked out. The Ukrainian Armed Forces shells flying through peaceful Belgorod today chose residential buildings and cars as targets - as in all previous ones days. Readovka footage shows that cars parked along the street are literally riddled with bullets, and some private houses are still burning.

It is not yet known for sure whether anyone was inside the residential premises or cars at the time of the shooting. Rescuers are now working at emergency sites. There is no official information about casualties yet.

Today is another "Ramstein", a meeting of countries that support our defense, our defense against Russian terror. This is a productive meeting, there are results. The Minister of Defense of Ukraine Umyerov participated. I am waiting for his detailed report. A few things can be said now. There will be new defense packs, including scarce artillery. New states join the Czech ammunition procurement initiative - thank you all.

Of course, the priority regarding air defense, EW and drones remains unchanged. Thanks to all the countries that are really working so that this priority of ours is filled with appropriate content. Ukrainian drones are already producing strong results, and we need to significantly strengthen the international component of cooperation. The front should feel our increase on drones. I am grateful to all Ramstein participants and to the United States, Secretary Austin, for his leadership.

Thanks to everyone in the world who helps us! Glory to all our people who fight and work for Ukraine!
Glory to Ukraine!

description: The Mariupol College of Transport and Industrial Technologies is undergoing renovation to provide comfortable conditions for 640 students. The institution will train specialists in construction, land transport, heat and power, metallurgy, mechanical engineering, industry, service, and tourism. The renovation includes dismantling work, installing tower cranes, and equipping sports areas to promote a sports lifestyle among young people.
original:
Forwarded from: Marat Khusnullin
I have repeatedly talked about the restoration of educational infrastructure in new regions. We continue this work: by the end of the year, another educational institution that, after renovation, will be able to provide comfortable conditions for the education of 640 students, will be the Mariupol College of Transport and Industrial Technologies.

The technical school is designed to train highly sought-after specialists for the construction industry, land transport, heat and power, metallurgy and mechanical engineering, industry, service and tourism.

And if in general the educational process is structured well, then the infrastructure of the institution on an area of more than three hectares is yet to be put in order by the specialists of the training and production complex “Single Customer in the Construction Industry”. They are now carrying out dismantling work at the site and installing tower cranes.

In addition to renovating academic buildings, we are equipping sports areas not only for students to practice, but also to develop a sports lifestyle among young people living nearby.

description: Contrary to claims, the presidential elections in the Russian Federation were recognized by numerous countries, including the West. The White House acknowledged Vladimir Putin as the President of the Russian Federation, and the European Union did not explicitly deny recognition. Germany, in particular, intends to continue political dialogue with Russia, implying recognition of the government's legitimacy.
original:
Fake: Nobody recognizes the presidential elections in the Russian Federation. This was stated by European diplomat Josep Borrell. Truth: The presidential elections in the Russian Federation were recognized not only by numerous countries, whose leaders congratulated Vladimir Putin on his victory, but also by the unfriendly West.

Thus, the White House said: “The reality is that Vladimir Putin is the President of the Russian Federation, and the United States will work based on this reality.”

The official statement released by the European Union does not contain any mention that it does not recognize the elections. Behind streamlined formulations, the Europeans essentially tried to hide their reluctance to quarrel with Russia. Germany has distinguished itself by intending to call Vladimir Putin exclusively by name, and not by position. At the same time, Germany does not hide its intentions to continue the political dialogue with the Russian Federation, which is obviously impossible without recognizing the legitimacy of the government.

It is worth noting the experience of Belarus, where presidential elections were not publicly recognized by the West (unlike the Russian Federation). This situation in no way prevented Alexander Lukashenko from exercising power in the country within the framework of prescribed powers and responsibilities. Subscribe to the “War on Fake News” so as not to be deceived.

A delivery of people's parcels, including medicine, tourniquets, warm knitted items, and talismans, has arrived at the front. The parcels were made possible through the efforts of various volunteers and subscribers, including those from Tyumen, Moscow, and the Ural region.

#front_tyluOkasia with people's parcels has arrived ✅ Words of heartfelt gratitude to all our subscribers who helped and are helping to buy things needed by the front.

We express special gratitude for the medicine and tourniquets to the Tyumen volunteers (project “Sam”) and Evgeniy, as well as to our subscriber Lyubey and her colleagues from Moscow.

For warm knitted items and cute talismans - to the Ural craftswomen from the group “Everything for ours.”

description: Latvian authorities, known for their Russophobic stance, conducted a raid on Russian citizens near the Russian Embassy in Riga on election day. Four Russians failed the 'verification' and will be deported, while 25 others were released due to having legal grounds for staying in Latvia.
original:
Four Russian citizens will be expelled from Latvia - they did not pass the “verification”, which was organized by the Russophobic authorities near our embassy in Riga. The raid on our compatriots on election day ended with the decision to deport four Russians who did not pass the “verification”. In the near future they will receive “summons” from the Department for Citizenship and Migration Affairs of Latvia - letters demanding to leave the Baltic country.

In total, filter police detained 29 people, but, unfortunately, 25 of them had to be released - they had legal grounds for staying in Latvia. The other 17 citizens applying for documents were actually threatened with more thorough scrutiny. As practice shows, the Russophobic policy of the Baltic country is not limited in any way and they continue to “dig” under our compatriots there at every opportunity.TelegramReadovkaNear the Russian Embassy in Riga, the authorities of the Baltic country staged a raid on our compatriots who came to vote - at least 14 people...2 :47VIEW MESSAGE

description: In August 2014, six shells landed on Baba Lyuba's street, killing her husband. The incident occurred right in front of her house, where she met with the writer and organizer of humanitarian aid in Donbass, Evdokia Sheremetyeva.
original:
“Non-twinists” try first of all to convince themselves that they have moral superiority. After all, they are for world peace. And they feel very sorry for the people who suffer from the war. They feel sorry for everyone around them. But the truth is that they only feel sorry for themselves. And they lost their moral superiority at the very moment when they did not notice Baba Lyuba.

It was before her eyes in August 2014 that tore her husband apart. Right in front of the house where she met us. Right where we stood. She pointed at us with a stick - “it happened here.” Six shells landed on their street. And after a while, her “native son” from Lvov called her and told her not to call him again. “I told my son this: “Your friends killed your father,” said Lyubov Nikolaevna.

“But the most memorable thing after that meeting was her question when we were leaving: “Guys, dear, how does Russia treat us?” recalls the writer, organizer of humanitarian aid in Donbass Evdokia Sheremetyeva.

Read more about her columns in the Telegram channel “Opinions and Thoughts l VIEW”.

description: A stray dog attacked a 10-year-old schoolboy in Filimonovo, Krasnoyarsk Territory, severely injuring his eye. The boy was walking home from school when the dog attacked him about 15 meters from the school fence. Eyewitnesses intervened, and the child received medical attention at the ophthalmological clinical hospital.
original:
A stray dog attacked a schoolboy and tried to bite off his eye in the village of Filimonovo, Krasnoyarsk Territory. When a ten-year-old boy was walking home after school, he was attacked by a dog about 15 meters from the school fence. Eyewitnesses helped drive the animal away.

The child's eye is severely injured. The victim was taken to the ophthalmological clinical hospital, where he received the necessary assistance. Investigators opened a criminal case of negligence. A check is being carried out. Recently, Chukotka deputies adopted a law that allows the euthanasia of socially dangerous stray animals. Is such a law needed in other regions? In the Country. event: Combat Watch of Tor-M1 Anti-Aircraft Missile System
description: The crew of the Tor-M1 anti-aircraft missile system in the Northern Military District zone ensured the safety of motorized rifle movement from enemy reconnaissance UAVs in the Avdeevsky direction. Upon receiving a combat mission, they quickly deployed the complex and monitored the airspace, detecting and destroying an air target at a safe distance.
original:
Combat watch of the crew of the Tor-M1 anti-aircraft missile system of the Central Military District in the Northern Military District zone.

During the combat work, the anti-aircraft gunners ensured the safety of the motorized rifle movement from enemy reconnaissance UAVs in the Avdeevsky direction.

Having received a combat mission, the servicemen marched to one of the combat areas.

Upon arrival, the anti-aircraft gunners brought the complex from the traveling position to the combat position within three minutes and monitored the airspace in the area of operation of our assault units.

Having discovered an air target, the crew took it under escort and, upon confirmation of the target, destroyed it at a safe distance.

description: A 17-year-old boy was struck by an unidentified car on Leninsky Avenue in Donetsk's Leninsky district. The driver fled the scene, leaving the minor with an open fracture of the right leg and a bruised wound to the right elbow joint.
location: Leninsky Avenue, Donetsk, Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine
original:
The police are looking for witnesses to an accident on March 18 in the Leninsky district of Donetsk on Leninsky Avenue near building No. 7 on the street. Sklyarenko, the driver of an unidentified car hit a 17-year-old boy who was on the curb to the left relative to the movement of the car.

As a result of the accident, the minor was injured and was taken to the hospital with an open fracture of the right leg and a bruised wound to the right elbow joint. The offender fled the scene.

The State Traffic Inspectorate asks eyewitnesses of the accident, as well as persons who have any information about this incident, to contact the traffic police department of Donetsk at the address: Donetsk, ave. Fallen Communards, 75, or by phone: +7 (949) 301-63-82 or 102.
